documentation.text: @dev Mapping from tokenId of a batch of tokens => to delayed reveal data.
@dev Sets the delayed reveal data for a batchId.

typeDescriptions.typeString: function (bytes memory,bytes calldata) pure returns (bytes memory)

encryptDecrypt(bytes,bytes).details: Encrypt/decrypt given `data` with `key`. Uses inline assembly.                  See: https://ethereum.stackexchange.com/questions/69825/decrypt-message-on-chain

params.key: Secure key used by caller for encryption/decryption.

returns.result: Output after encryption/decryption of given data.

getRevealURI(uint256,bytes).details: Reveal encrypted base URI for `_batchId` with caller/admin's `_key` used for encryption.                      Reverts if there's no encrypted URI for `_batchId`.                      See {encryptDecrypt}.

params._batchId: ID of the batch for which URI is being revealed.
params._key: Secure key used by caller/admin for encryption of baseURI.

isEncryptedBatch(uint256).details: Returns `true` if `_batchId`'s base URI is encrypted.

params._batchId: ID of a batch of NFTs.

params.identifier: The ID for the batch of delayed-reveal NFTs to reveal.
params.key: The key with which the base URI for the relevant batch of NFTs was encrypted.

encryptedData.details: Mapping from tokenId of a batch of tokens => to delayed reveal data.

getRevealURI(uint256,bytes).notice: Returns revealed URI for a batch of NFTs.

isEncryptedBatch(uint256).notice: Returns whether the relvant batch of NFTs is subject to a delayed reveal.

reveal(uint256,bytes).notice: Reveals a batch of delayed reveal NFTs.

userdoc.notice: Thirdweb's `DelayedReveal` is a contract extension for base NFT contracts. It lets you create batches of           'delayed-reveal' NFTs. You can learn more about the usage of delayed reveal NFTs here - https://blog.thirdweb.com/delayed-reveal-nfts
